COMMENT:
I don't see any error for Flip for DND, every FTM event from the sensor it set as true/false correctly.

There is one enable and disable DND (near 05-31 14:12:41.861) but it was not by Flip for DND, could it be from the user ?

*Be aware the user set repeated callers* and if the call was if the same number it will mute the sound.

[~brunocp] did you use different sim card number to test it ? Otherwise like [~eversonv] and I comment, it will not mute the sound of the call. This is how Android's DND works... Flip for DND just follows the same behaviour.

description:
*Software Version:*
     motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.129/9ba7f:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

*Build Location:*
    https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/continuous_builds/nio/RRT31_nio-retail_userdebug_mr_r-qsm8250_test-keys_continuous/1054/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/

*=== Reproducing the issue ===*

*- Steps to reproduce:*
1. Open the moto action apps > enable flip for DND function;
2. Try use the function.

*- Actual result*
2. The flip for DND function is not working correctly.

=== Additional information ===

*Reproduction rate:* 5/5.
*Dalek Cycle:* https://dalek.mot.com/browse/CQA-7365
*Test Case:* https://dalek.mot.com/browse/CQA-7370

*=== Attachments ===*

Video: [Evidence.mp4|https://idart.mot.com/secure/attachment/2739270/VID_20210507_092020149.mp4]
B2G: [Here|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/314600171]
COMMENT:
I tested the presented scenario and it worked as expected.
Problem not reproduced.

Obs:
There is a function called: "Allow repeat call". (rule of repetead callers as default).
If this button is enabled, and if the same person calls for the second time in less than 15 minutes,
the phone will continue to ring as shown in the video.
so, to make continuous calls and the "flip for DND" function works, the "Allow repeat called" button
it must be disabled.

COMMENT:
[~eversonv] please take a look, verify if the test is correct.

[~brunocp] Flip for DND is just a shortcut for DND in Android, so it will follows the same behavior. If you use the same phone number with repeated callers enabled, you will get the sound in the calls unless you wait 15 minutes between them. You can change, flip down to enable Android's DND and flip up to disables it.

description:
*Software Version*
Build Version: RPD31.31 e RPN31.60
fingerprint: motorola/racer_retail/racer:11/RPD31.31/7a4eb:userdebug/test-keys

*=== Reproducing the issue ===*

Sim Cards: Tim and Oi

TP: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2456168
TC: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2462773

*– Steps to reproduce:*
1. Disable SIM1 and SIM2
2. Remove SIM2 and change to another one,that was never inserted on device. Check the behavior
3. Remove SIM1 and change to another one, that was never inserted on device. Check the behavior.
4. Remove SIM1 and SIM2, changed on Steps 4 and 5. Insert both simcards used on step 1.

*– Expected results*
2. SIM1 and SIM2 options are not displayed. On Mobile Network screen. SIM1 status is "Disable". For SIM2: Carrier name is displayed and the status is "Enable".
3. SIM1 and SIM2 options displayed. On Mobile Network screen, For SIM1 and SIM2 : Carrier name is displayed and the status is "Enable".
4. SIM1 and SIM2 options are not displayed. On Mobile Network screen, SIM1 amd SIM2 status are "Disable".

*– Actual result:*
2. On Mobile Network screen. SIM1 status *is "Enable"* (should be disable)
4. On Mobile Network screen, SIM1 and SIM2 status *are "Enable".* (should be inactive)  

*=== Attachments - log ===*
*Log bugreport:* https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gNRCPKSuCfAMtCpUSCMaapwC_QkDYACe/view?usp=sharing
*Aplog:* https://drive.google.com/file/d/1el5dhl7BcarvT6CdtDPudky5xAjRAHCK/view?usp=sharing
*Video:* https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_i_-pBLkxXh8B1h9FQI9cciGIsgNxxWU/view?usp=sharing
COMMENT:
It is a change made in AOSP  by Google to intentionally reenable a unplugged sim card. [~mailtonf], please consider if this change is reasonable for Moto perspective. Add [~wjm097] and [~caioluiz]
{noformat}
Set uicc applications enabled after a SIM is removed.

Per design from UX and PM we want a SIM to enable if user
unplugs and inserts it back. The reason is that would very
likely be users' expectation.

Bug: 151746804
Test: manual and unittest

Change-Id: I695e345a15de4c09551c4876191178903fa6b945
{noformat}

COMMENT:
hi, [~caioluiz]
in andorid R product, if use HAL1.5, then google has the design above
but some upgrate product(android R) will use HAL1.4 still, then won't use the code design, follow the behavior in android Q

I mean
in *Racer(android R. HAL1.5)*
 after remove SIM Card "Disable", then insert slot again, shown status as "Enable"

in some *upgrate product(android R HAL1.5)*
 after remove SIM Card "Disable", then insert slot again, shown status as "Disable" still

we can accept the different behavior between products in andorid R, right?

fingerprint: motorola/racer_retail/racer:11/RPD31.31/7a4eb:userdebug/test-keys

*=== Reproducing the issue ===*

Sim Cards: Tim and Oi

TP: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2456168
TC: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2462773

*– Steps to reproduce:*
1. Disable SIM1 and SIM2
2. Remove SIM2 and change to another one,that was never inserted on device. Check the behavior
3. Remove SIM1 and change to another one, that was never inserted on device. Check the behavior.
4. Remove SIM1 and SIM2, changed on Steps 4 and 5. Insert both simcards used on step 1.

*– Expected results*
2. SIM1 and SIM2 options are not displayed. On Mobile Network screen. SIM1 status is "Disable". For SIM2: Carrier name is displayed and the status is "Enable".
3. SIM1 and SIM2 options displayed. On Mobile Network screen, For SIM1 and SIM2 : Carrier name is displayed and the status is "Enable".
4. SIM1 and SIM2 options are not displayed. On Mobile Network screen, SIM1 amd SIM2 status are "Disable".

*– Actual result:*
2. On Mobile Network screen. SIM1 status *is "Enable"* (should be disable)
4. On Mobile Network screen, SIM1 and SIM2 status *are "Enable".* (should be inactive)  

*=== Attachments - log ===*
*Log bugreport:* https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gNRCPKSuCfAMtCpUSCMaapwC_QkDYACe/view?usp=sharing
*Aplog:* https://drive.google.com/file/d/1el5dhl7BcarvT6CdtDPudky5xAjRAHCK/view?usp=sharing
*Video:* https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_i_-pBLkxXh8B1h9FQI9cciGIsgNxxWU/view?usp=sharing
COMMENT:
[~mailtonf], could you get bug2go and ap logs with following command with your test in latest release?
1. adb root
2. adb pull /data/vendor/aplogd

*– Expected results*
2. SIM1 and SIM2 options are not displayed. On Mobile Network screen. SIM1 status is "Disable". For SIM2: Carrier name is displayed and the status is "Enable".
3. SIM1 and SIM2 options displayed. On Mobile Network screen, For SIM1 and SIM2 : Carrier name is displayed and the status is "Enable".
4. SIM1 and SIM2 options are not displayed. On Mobile Network screen, SIM1 amd SIM2 status are "Disable".

*– Actual result:*
2. On Mobile Network screen. SIM1 status *is "Enable"* (should be disable)

COMMENT:
[Dual SIM PRD|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ttx8MAQzdwPs8i9Vd0WMR7C2KDI-YMS0xKw_SwRzgO0/edit#heading=h.71m28aozzrs7] page 20 suggests that an inserted SIM card should be automatically enabled only if new SIM - that means that TC is correct and actually failing before Motorola spec.

[~wjm097], do you think we should tolerate this behavior change proposed by AOSP (i.e., automatically enable a re-inserted SIM, even though that had been previously disabled in this very same device and SIM slot)?

*Expected result:*

*According this* [DOCUMENT|https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1xAdB8bXjELxoVQOX0C87pUm2oV_PiqO3YjRcIVmoxtU/edit#slide=id.g6549a96750_3_326]

*Bug2Go link:*	https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/311704647

=== Reproducing the issue ===

h5. SW version:
- motorola/racer_retail/racer:11/RPD31.54/01c68a:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

h5. Build location: [RPD.31.54|https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/racer/11/RPD31.54/racer_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
HW version: DVT1
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

h5. Setup steps or Settings
{quote}
# Moto APP > Moto display > edge lights > Settings > "incoming call" should be enable
# Active the Do Not Disturb (DND)
{quote}

h5. Steps to reproduce
{quote}

# Put DUT in facedown 
# Receive incoming call from whatsApp  
# observer
{quote}

*Actual result:*
- DUT is show light effect on the edge 

*Expected result:*
- DUT shoud not show any light effect on the edge with option to DND is active
*According this* [DOCUMENT|https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1xAdB8bXjELxoVQOX0C87pUm2oV_PiqO3YjRcIVmoxtU/edit#slide=id.g6549a96750_3_326]

*Reproduce Rate:* 100%


=== Additional information ===

Dalek cycle path:https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2456192

Test Case ID: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2500482
*Bug2Go link:*	https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/311704647
COMMENT:
I think the issue is not in MotoLights.
I've noticed that repeatedCallers rule has no impact on WhatsApp Call (VoIP calls), and only takes in consideration calls from dialer app.

In the first scenario, I think that starred contact made up Lights to show, which is expected since WhatsApp Call UI probably was displayed as well.

Based on that, I'm moving this CR to SystemUI bucket to check DND behavior and if repeated callers should or not impact on VOIP Call. If not, I think we can close this CR as WAD/Cancelled. Otherwise, need to dig further to understand why the scenario described above had happened.

+[~roseane]

motorola/racer_retail/racer:11/RPD31.61/a0a7a:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

Build location:
https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/racer/11/RPD31.61/racer_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/fastboot_racer_retail_userdebug_11_RPD31.61_a0a7a_intcfg-test-keys_retail_US.tar.gz

HW version:
DVT2

------------------------------------------------------------------

Setup steps or settings:
1. Have a Secondary user added.
2. Have Lock screen and fingerprint on both users.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Set a fingerprint and zero tap to unlock the phone.
2. Switch to the second user and Set a fingerprint.
3. Return to the primary user.
4. Return to secondary user.

Actual Result:
1. Pattern is requested every when Switch to secondary user.

Expected result:
1. The pattern must be request only if the device it's in DBM, at the return to main user from secondary and going to secondary at second time, the fingerprint must be requested.

=== Additional information ===

Number of times the issue has been reproduced: 5/5 - 100.00%

COMMENT: Based on the analysis done by Alex and Kangho, I agree the behavior raised in this CR is WAD on Android R.

Setup steps or settings:

Steps to reproduce:

1. Set a fingerprint and zero tap to unlock the phone.
2. Switch to the second user and Set a fingerprint.
3. Return to the primary user.
4. Return to secondary user.

Actual Result:
1. Pattern is requested every when Switch to secondary user.

Expected result:
1. The pattern must be request only if the device it's in DBM, at the return to main user from secondary and going to secondary at second time, the fingerprint must be requested.

COMMENT:
[~afelicio] Hello Alex, there's been multiple CR's related to Keyguard + FPS authentication, such as IKSWR-10903 and IKSWR-12575. 

where Keyguard requests authentication when its either not supposed to or at a wrong time. Maybe they have some relations to this CR? 
This issue isn't reproducible 100% of the time, but when I tried, I was able to reproduce it 8/10 times. Let me know if you need any thing. Thanks.

*Edit:* This issue doesn't seem to occur on *RPB31.Q4U-18*

This form was peer reviewed by: [~thiagof]
COMMENT:
[~edjunior] Hi Edmilson

So currently what I've noticed is that once you switch to Guest User, DUT will reboot, this behavior was observed on Google Pixel which was tested by [~afelicio] and we concluded that it is normal for the DUT to request pattern over fingerprint, when it has switched to Guest User because DUT will always reboot, same with Google Pixel. So we think maybe a Google buganizer needs to be opened.

*EDIT:* After some discussion, this will be marked as WAD since it is in R baseline that switching to Guest User will prompt DUT to restart, as with Pixel, and therefore it is normal behavior for Pattern/PIN/Password to take priority over fingerprint. Once unlocked using Pattern/PIN/Password, Guest Users are able to unlock using fingerprints.

COMMENT:
From the logs only suspicious logs are the error logs that binder died {noformat}10-07 13:50:44.792  1000  1693  9474 E BiometricService: Enabled callback binder died
10-07 13:50:44.792  1000  1693  9830 E FingerprintService: Lockout reset callback binder died
10-07 13:50:44.792  1000  1693  9477 E FaceService: Lockout reset callback binder died{noformat}

From the logs, Fodmanager only seems to acknowledge the user switching back to primary
{noformat}10-07 13:50:43.365  1000  1693  1693 D FodManager: onUserSwitching=0{noformat}

But I don't see a log for when the user is switching to secondary, which would be userId=10 in this case.

[~edjunior] May I ask what the scenario was in the bugreport? Was it primary -> secondary -> primary
I don't have the device on me, so please bear with me.

Edit: I had a colleague try this issue on a Q build and it worked perfectly fine, with the binder died error messages so I don't think those logs have to do with this issue.

4. Return to secondary user.

Actual Result:
1. Pattern is requested every when Switch to secondary user.

Expected result:
1. The pattern must be request only if the device it's in DBM, at the return to main user from secondary and going to secondary at second time, the fingerprint must be requested.

=== Additional information ===

Number of times the issue has been reproduced: 5/5 - 100.00%

Timestamp: 1:51 p.m.

BugReport: bugreport-racer_retail-RPD31.61-2020-10-07-13-54-01

This form was peer reviewed by: [~thiagof]
COMMENT:
*SystemUI* team, please help analyzing this issue. I'm having trouble tracing back where authentication client is coming from.

When user switches, it prompts enumeration
{noformat}10-20 15:05:46.220  1666  1666 V FingerprintService: Enumerating user(11){noformat} But authentication result comes in before enumeration client begins, resulting in a race condition I mentioned in the above comment and will remove the authentication client.
{noformat}10-20 15:05:48.008  1666  1666 V FingerprintService: startAuthentication(com.android.systemui)
10-20 15:05:48.008  1666  1666 V FingerprintService: starting client AuthenticationClientImpl(com.android.systemui) targetUserId: 11 currentUserId: 11 cookie: 0/0
10-20 15:05:48.081  1666  1666 W FingerprintService: client com.android.systemui is authenticating...
10-20 15:05:48.313  1666  1666 V FingerprintService: request stop current client com.android.systemui{noformat}
{noformat}10-20 15:05:50.023  1666  1666 V FingerprintService: start pending client android
10-20 15:05:50.024  1666  1666 V FingerprintService: starting client EnumerateClient(android) targetUserId: 11 currentUserId: 11 cookie: 0/0{noformat}

There is currently a check in the case Authentication Client comes in during Enumeration Client, which will then be saved as *mPendingClient* and run after Enumeration Client has finished https://sse.am.mot.com/r_source/xref/mr-r-qsh2020/frameworks/base/services/core/java/com/android/server/biometrics/BiometricServiceBase.java#1310. 
However, in this case Authentication client begins before Enumeration Client, since Authentication Client is requested from SystemUI, please take a look and see if any feedback can be made.

h5. Setup steps or Settings
{quote}
# Get multiple notifications of the same app (Eg: Hangout messages from different people)
{quote}

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Device should be in AOD secren 
# Touch and hold the notification icon > Swipe left or right to dismiss notification from moto display 
# Unlock the device and check the presence of notification dot	

*Actual result:*
- Notification is dismissed from notification bar

*Expected result:*
- Notification dot is present since swiping left or swiping right on Moto display does not dismiss the notifications from notification bar

*Reproduce Rate:* 100%

=== Additional information ===

Dalek cycle path:https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2456170
Test Case ID: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2481979
*Bug2Go link:* 	https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/311797674
COMMENT:
I guess we have a misunderstood here. Swipe notifications to left or right does dismiss the notifications from notification bar which is exactly what happened in the video.
The notification dot is present because there are other notifications in the notification bar besides the ones dismissed on moto display.

This is *WAD*.

Issue timestamp: 4:38PM(device time) data 10/15

-Bug2Go link:
-https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/311911139
Issue timestamp: 8:59AM(device time) data 10/16





========Following video reproducible=======
https://drive.google.com/file/d/19mx48wLrNzIZnrUVPTueRzGSXABOmQzK/view?usp=sharing
COMMENT:
*Problem description:* Edge Lights shows and stop
*Root cause summary:* Actually the lights isn't stopping. The adaptive brightness is on and the brightness is decrease, but if you look, the animation is there. I asked a lot of tests for reporter and she uploaded the videos. Also, I made some tests and attached.

adaptive_brightness_off.mp4: the animation is showing as brightness value defined.
adaptive_brightness_on.mp4: you can realize that it starts with brightness defined but the brightness decreases, but animation still there.

{panel:title=Log of adaptive_brightness_on.mp4|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
10-16 13:48:00.873  1405  1901 D DisplayPowerController: updatePowerState: policy=BRIGHT, useProximitySensor=false, screenBrightnessOverride=NaN, *useAutoBrightness=true*, screenAutoBrightnessAdjustmentOverride=NaN, screenLowPowerBrightnessFactor=1.0, blockScreenOn=false, lowPowerMode=false, boostScreenBrightness=false, dozeScreenBrightness=NaN, dozeScreenState=UNKNOWN
10-16 13:48:00.873  1405  1901 D DisplayPowerController: Animating brightness: mIsSupportHaab=false, *currentBrightness=0.9902013, target=0.003937008*, rate=0.2352941, nits = 3.6, AmbientLux = 0.0, isHbmTrigger = false
{panel}
*Reproducible:* YES
*Enough logs available:* YES
*Next Step:* This is a expected behavior of adaptive brightness and it is not an edge lights issue.

description:
h2. Configuration
---- 
* SW Version: motorola/denver_global/denver:12/SRE32.18/29240-72a78:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

h2. Frequency
---- 
* 100% (5 of 5) of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
---- 
# Have a Screen Lock set up. (Pattern, PIN, Password, FPS)

h2. Steps to Reproduce
---- 
# Add an emergency contact.
 # Lock and unlock screen.
 # Tap "emergency call" , then "emergency information".
 # Check if new contact has been added.
 # Reboot the device.
 # Repeat steps 3 and 4.

h2. Actual behavior
---- 
* Emergency contacts gone after reboot.

h2. Expected behavior
---- 
* Emergency contacts persist even after reboot.

h2. Remarks
---- 
* *Sometimes displays the emergency contact after lock and unlock screen for the first time after the reboot.*
 * *Emergency contacts displays after unlock device putting any "Screen Lock" method (Pattern, PIN, Password or FPS).*

 * [Video|https://drive.google.com/file/d/16wwaAw7ip8xDD6k9tG8WXPcB-zseC3sb/view?usp=sharing]

description:
h2. Configuration

----
* Build version: motorola/berlin_global/berlin:13/TRG33.23/b95c2-85:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
* Carrier: timbr
* Sim Card: TIM

h2. Frequency
----
* 100% (5 of 5) of reproducibility 


h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
# ro.carrier set to timbr
# Factory Reset
# Wifi disabled


h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
*Multiwindow disabled*
# at the end of the setup wizard insert the SIM card
# Wait for the SIM card Selection screen to appear
# Press the recent apps button
# Press the icon above the SIM card Selection screen
# Note the absence of the Split Screen option

*Multiwindow enabled*
# at the end of the setup wizard open the Bug2Go app
# Start a log capture and press the home button
# Insert the SIM card and wait for the SIM card Selection screen to appear
# Press the recent apps button
# Press the icon above the SIM card Selection screen
# Note the presence of the Split Screen option

h1. Actual behavior
----
* Split screen option only appears when bug2go is triggered



h2. Expected behavior
----
* Split screen option should appear without needing to trigger Bug2Go



h2. Remarks
----
* Issue timestamp: with bug2go -> 02:07 pm, no bug2go -> 01:59 pm
* Logcat: [no_bug2go|^no_bug2go.txt];[with_bug2go|^with_bug2go.txt]+[bug2go|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/320806841]

h2. Remarks
----
* Issue timestamp: with bug2go -> 02:07 pm, no bug2go -> 01:59 pm
* Logcat: [no_bug2go|^no_bug2go.txt];[with_bug2go|^with_bug2go.txt]+[bug2go|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/320806841]
* Test Case Execution ID: [MCA-3591822|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3591822]
* Video: [no_bug2go|^no_bug2go.mp4] [with_bug2go|^with_bug2go.mp4]
 

This form was per-reviewed by [~]
COMMENT:
Hi all,
Checking the videos provided, this behavior is consistent with new Android T design for split screen, when there is only one task in Recents screen, the option to split with another app will *not* be displayed.

In [with_bug2go|https://idart.mot.com/secure/attachment/3294612/with_bug2go.mp4], the selection sim card data activity  will show split screen option because there is more than one task in Recents screen.

I'm moving this issue to *FW UX - SystemUI* team check if this is working as designed.

Regards

*Multiwindow enabled*
# at the end of the setup wizard open the Bug2Go app
# Start a log capture and press the home button
# Insert the SIM card and wait for the SIM card Selection screen to appear
# Press the recent apps button
# Press the icon above the SIM card Selection screen
# Note the presence of the Split Screen option

h1. Actual behavior
----
* Split screen option only appears when bug2go is triggered



h2. Expected behavior
----
* Split screen option should appear without needing to trigger Bug2Go



h2. Remarks
----
* Issue timestamp: with bug2go -> 02:07 pm, no bug2go -> 01:59 pm
* Logcat: [no_bug2go|^no_bug2go.txt];[with_bug2go|^with_bug2go.txt]+[bug2go|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/320806841]
* Test Case Execution ID: [MCA-3591822|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3591822]
* Video: [no_bug2go|^no_bug2go.mp4] [with_bug2go|^with_bug2go.mp4]
 

This form was per-reviewed by [~]
COMMENT:
*[FW UI Analysis]*
 *Knowledge area:* Multi window (split-screen).
 *Problem description:* User is complaining that can't put mobile data wizard on split-screen mode.
 *Analysis:* By analyzing the videos shown, on the video [^no_bug2go.mp4] the mobile data wizard is the only app on Recents screen. This is a new behavior on Android T: when there is only one app on Recents there won't be an option to put the app on split-screen mode. This new behavior is called "app-pair model" (on Android S and before they call it "pinned-app model").

On the other video, [^with_bug2go.mp4], it's possible to put the app on split-screen mode because there are more than one app on Recents.

*Next Step:* Requesting WAD approval based on "Consistent with in-base behavior" because this is the new Android T split-screen behavior.

description:
*=== Reproducing the issue ===*

*SW version:* motorola/nairo_retail/nairo:11/RPN31.70/7bbf3:userdebug/test-keys
Build location link: https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/nairo/11/RPN31.70/nairo_retail/ 
*HW version:* DVT1
*Secure HW:* Not secure

*Setup steps or settings:*
- Power touch turned on (Moto App > Gesture > Power Touch)
- Only Side FPS supported devices.
- Have some notifications

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Enter "Power touch" settings in "Settings", enable "Swipe up/down" option. 
(Moto App > Gestures > Power Touch > Settings)

*Actual result:*

1. No Swipe Up/Down option in Power Touch Settings. 
Only two options available, Touch settings options are missing in android R.
[^Screenshot_powertouchsettings.png]

*Expected Result:*
1. Should be able enable "Swipe up/down" option, according to this documentation https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Y5m2VwbsJcl7m2Km5BABtgBphpOqGkd9txt0usKwyW8/edit#slide=id.g83698ad521_10_198

=== Additional information ===

This issue is 100% reporducible.

Dalek test case: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2470314

*BugReport ID:* 311887407
*Bug2Go Logs:*
https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/311887407
COMMENT: [~wcdb78] the UX has been updated.https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Y5m2VwbsJcl7m2Km5BABtgBphpOqGkd9txt0usKwyW8/edit#slide=id.g7e0706827d93f9a7_4

 * *100% (5 of 5) of reproducibility*

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
 # Setup Wizard Completed
 # 2 devices available
 # One game installed (eg: Angry Birds) 
 # Dark theme On 
 # Have many apps opened
 # Auto Rotation On

h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Initiate a call 
 # Go to a game 
 # Active the Multiwindow/Split screen Mode and Landscape
 # Active the Game and the Call on Split screen
 # Place your hand next to the sensor when trying to play a game
 # Observe

h2. Actual behavior
----
 * When playing a game with a call on "split screen", a black screen appears when put your hand next to the sensor.

h2. Expected behavior
----
 * When playing a game with a call on "split screen", the phone call sensor should not work. 
 * The same occurs when the call is stay in the background (Check on the video attached)

h2. Remarks
----
 * Test Case Execution ID:  [MCA-3137039|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3137039]

This form was peer-reviewed by:
COMMENT:
This a valid behavior. When the call audio is set for earpiece, it will activate the proximity sensor.
Try to put call on speaker phone or connect external listening device(wired or wireless).

*=== Reproducing the issue ===*
-- Steps to reproduce:
1. Turn the device face down;
2. Receive a notification (such as Message);
3. Watch the device edges.

-- Expected results
2. There should be a waterfall effect when receiving the notification.

2. The edges only blink a whit light.

description:
*Software Version*
- motorola/burton_vzw/burton:11/RPB31.Q1-21/905c2:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

*Build Location*
- http://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/burton/11/RPB31.Q1-21/burton_vzw/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/

*=== Reproducing the issue ===*

-- Precondition:
1. External display and HDMI adapter available
2. Camera version: 7.3.31.1-Whitney

-- Steps to reproduce:
1. Tap and Hold in camera app > information > Storage & cache > Clear storage > ok;
2. Back to home screen > open camera app > tap While using the app;
3. Tap ok > choice a mode available > try to open the available modes by swiping to the right.

-- Expected results
4. The available modes should appear and, consequently, it must be possible to select some other mode. 

-- Actual result
4. None of the available modes appear.

*=== Additional information ===*

Reproduction rate: 4/4.
Dalek Cycle: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2657279
This issue only occurs when opening the camera for the first time.

*=== Attachments ===*
evidence.mp4
COMMENT: camera modes are disabled in desktop

description:
=== Reproducing the issue ===

*sw version:*
motorola/racer_retail/racer:11/RPD31.103/9e0f0:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
*HW version:*
DVT2
*Build location:* 
Racer 5G: https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/racer/11/RPD31.103/racer_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/

------------------------------------------------------------------

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Open YouTube application
2. Click on the "Camcorder icon" in the upper right of the screen and start recording
3. Do Twist for quick capture gesture and take a couple of pictures (Use Double tap for power button if TFQC not available) while video is being recorded
4. Return to Youtube app
5. Take a short video and upload it to YouTube

*Expected result:*
3. DUT switches to Camera app and pictures can be taken succesfully.
4. Verify that video that was being recorded on step 2 is saved
5. Youtube applicaiton works as expected

*Actual result:*
3. DUT NOT switches to Camera app (both by quick capture and double click on power button)

=== Additional information ===

TP: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2622289
TC: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2687637

*Bug2Go*:
Report ID: 313145804
Report Link: https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/313145804
COMMENT:
Hi [~monicam], Any return about this? 
because it's still happening on lastest build (RPD31.Q2-16)
Awaiting.

description:
*FP Build:* motorola/denver_global/denver:11/RRE31.Q2-5/484ef:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
*HW Version:* DVT1


h5. Setup steps or Settings
# Have a BT headset connected to DUT and put it in your ear
# Have a SUP
# Enable the DND feature on DUT (Settings > Sound > DO not Disturb)
# On *WHAT CAN INTERRUPT DO NOT DISTURB* make the following changes on the People option
- Calls: Contacts
- ALLOW REPEAT CALLERS: disabled
 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# On SUP side, call DUT
# Enable SPEAKER on SUP to ensure that the call was started
# On DUT side, observe the screen


h5. Actual Result
- No notification is displayed on DUT but the sound notification can be ear on BT headset

h5. Expected Result
- No sound should be ear on BT headset


*Dalek cycle path:* https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2739066
*Test Case ID:* https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2739218


*Logs:* [Bug2Gp|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/313687016], [^bugreport-denver_global.zip]
*Video:* [^Issue_Denver.mp4]


*Note:*
- This CR is not reproducible on Pixel device (RQ1A.210205.004) [^bugreport-pixel.zip], [^Behavior_Pixel.mp4]
- All bugreports files were captured using the Bugreport found in settings and the *Enable Bluetooth HCI snoop log* option was *enabled* (Developer options). For Denver device also was enabled the *Enable bigger btsnoop size* option.
COMMENT:
This issue is occurring on *Tahoe* device using *RRT312.Q2-11* build:

- *FP:* motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q2-11/b0b88:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
- *Bug2Go:* https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/313696159

{code}

Denver didn't support in-band ring, and when remote bt headset received the ring indication 'RING', it will ring by itself, who does not rely on the ring sound of the phone.
Pixel is supported in-band ring, so the BT headset ring sound will be same with the phone. As the Pixel DND enabled and has no ring sound, so bt headset also has no ringsound.

And check the test case https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2739218, there's note in the Initial Setup, so this is expected behavior.
{panel}
Key Areas of Concentration:
Note 2: Even with total silence enabled, if the device receive a MT call with hs BT connected, the ringtone will ring on hs BT.
{panel}

COMMENT:
Ringer mode: 
- mode (internal) = NORMAL
- mode (external) = SILENT
- zen mode:ZEN_MODE_IMPORTANT_INTERRUPTIONS
- ringer mode affected streams = 0x1a6 (STREAM_SYSTEM,STREAM_RING,STREAM_NOTIFICATION,STREAM_SYSTEM_ENFORCED,STREAM_DTMF)
- ringer mode muted streams = 0x2 (STREAM_SYSTEM)
- delegate = ZenModeHelper

value of enable_dnd_notification_bluetooth_only is false

description:
*=== Reproducing the issue ===*
 *Build location:* [https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/nio/11/RRT31.Q3-11/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/]
 *SW version:* motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-11/2b692:userdebug/test-keys
 *HW version:* DVT1a
 *Secure HW:* Not secure

 

*Initial Setup:*

Note: According to AoD Feature leader, New AoD only will be supported from NPIs 2020.

In Peek Display settings, Clock options is seted to "Standard Clock"

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. View the AOD interface when plugged in/out USB charger.

*Expected Result:*

1. The charging animation, charging icon and battery will be displayed, and then return to the AOD interface

*Actual result:*
 - No charging animation, no charging icon and battery it not displayed on AoD. 

 

*=== Additional information ===*
 *Dalek cycle path:* *[https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2865759]*
 *Dalek test case:* *[https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2866030]*

*Expect Result:* According [this document|https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1KXJWdIKW08fDGQRKdU8o4vG_xLphTD0nxJ7HZyJtGqE/edit?ts=5e8b89f0#slide=id.g7ffed93bae_4_32], the new charging UI shoud be available from NPIs 2020, so, Tahoe is NPI 2020 and Denver is NPI 2021. but these new microinteractions do not happen when connecting and disconnecting the phone to the power souce. 

I report this because the first screen is implemented and running, but _her sister_ is not, which should generally be the same.

[^AoD_charging_icon.JPG]
 * *Vídeo:* [HERE|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xsvVg_GxYj3OOipb6A4XXsC3sIzueqL3/view?usp=sharing]

 

*Bug2Go Logs:*
 BugReport ID: [315058387|https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmmibug2go.appspot.com%2F%23%2Fapp%2Freport%2F315058387&data=04%7C01%7Cmailtonf%40motorola.com%7Cf48eebd048a14190c6aa08d9276c481c%7C5c7d0b28bdf8410caa934df372b16203%7C1%7C0%7C637584168282094760%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=qI7CVI1qhvuJC4aPpNN2%2FvGlntp%2BeBHSeD9h5FDKre8%3D&reserved=0]

Report link: [https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/315058387|https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmmibug2go.appspot.com%2F%23%2Fapp%2Freport%2F315058387&data=04%7C01%7Cmailtonf%40motorola.com%7Cf48eebd048a14190c6aa08d9276c481c%7C5c7d0b28bdf8410caa934df372b16203%7C1%7C0%7C637584168282104716%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=lFeRWg4jVS9Ta7vur5gdrl821izK04DKBgx2QzMu3Mc%3D&reserved=0]

description:
*=== Reproducing the issue ===*
 *Build location:* [https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/nio/11/RRT31.Q3-11/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/]
 *SW version:* motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-11/2b692:userdebug/test-keys
 *HW version:* DVT1a
 *Secure HW:* Not secure

 

*Initial Setup:*

Note: According to AoD Feature leader, New AoD only will be supported from NPIs 2020.

In Peek Display settings, Clock options is seted to "Standard Clock"

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. View the AOD interface when plugged in/out USB charger.

*Expected Result:*

1. The charging animation, charging icon and battery will be displayed, and then return to the AOD interface

*Actual result:*
 - No charging animation, no charging icon and battery it not displayed on AoD. 

 

*=== Additional information ===*
 *Dalek cycle path:* *[https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2865759]*
 *Dalek test case:* *[https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2866030]*

*Expect Result:* According [this document|https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1KXJWdIKW08fDGQRKdU8o4vG_xLphTD0nxJ7HZyJtGqE/edit?ts=5e8b89f0#slide=id.g7ffed93bae_4_32], the new charging UI shoud be available from NPIs 2020, so, Tahoe is NPI 2020 and Denver is NPI 2021. but these new microinteractions do not happen when connecting and disconnecting the phone to the power souce. 

I report this because the first screen is implemented and running, but _her sister_ is not, which should generally be the same.

[^AoD_charging_icon.JPG]

description:
=== *Reproducing the issue* ===

*SW version:* 
- motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-24/5ee3b:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

*Build location:* [Tahoe RRT31.Q3-24|https://artifacts.mot.com:443/artifactory/nio/11/RRT31.Q3-24/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/fastboot_nio_retail_userdebug_11_RRT31.Q3-24_5ee3b_intcfg-test-keys_retail_US.tar.gz]

------------------------------------------------------------------
 *HW version:* DVT1a
 ------------------------------------------------------------------

*Setup steps or settings:*
{quote} # Setup Wizard Completed;
 # Ro.carrier: *retbr*.
 # Three finger Screenshot set ON  {quote}

*Steps to reproduce:*
{quote} # Receive a call on DUT
 # Accept the Call
 # Try to take a screenshot with three finger on any screen {quote}

*Actual result:*
 - Three Finger Screenshot function is not work

*Expected result:*
 -  Three Finger Screenshot function shall be work

*Number of times the issue has been reproduced:* 3/3 - 100.00%

=== *Additional information* ===

*Dalek cycle path:* [Test Plan|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2898076]

Video file attached
[*Video*|https://drive.google.com/file/d/17wAxMPfM--6jxwNrp_qV5G8Q80MdquSq/view?usp=sharing]

*Bugreport:*
 - [Bug2Go|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/315270010] - Issue timestamp: 2:40 PM device time

*Comments:*
 - Moto APP Version: 9.0.135
 - Manual Screenshot work without issue when ongoing call.

*This form was peer reviewed by:* [~thiagof]
COMMENT:
Hi all,
Could you change the resolution about this CR?
The issue is not a WAD. When the Device is a call, it shall be possible to take a screenshot with three fingers on any screen. 

And this CR is fixed. 
The issue was possibly fixed on another builds.
The issue is not reproducible on motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-39/7138d5:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys.

COMMENT:
I don't understand your point.

The intended behavior is that while you're on a call you're not able to take screenshots through Moto Action's gesture.

If you really need it, you can do it with the Power+Volume key combo.

 

Now, if you're able to take screenshots of the dialing screen on any build, please open another bug CR.

description:
h2. Configuration
---- 
 * Application version: Moto Gametime version 31.01.0.02.0
 * [Build Location|https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/nio/12/S0RT32.3/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/]
 * SW version: motorola/nio_retail/nio:12/S0RT32.3/c198d-19710:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * HW version: dvt1a

h2. Frequency
---- 
* 100% (5 of 5) of reproducibility.

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
---- 
* N/A

h2. Steps to Reproduce
---- 
 # Open Audio effects settings on Moto App
 # Disable "Auto" option and enable "Game" option
 # Set any equalizer option and modify Bass boost
 # Open Moto Gametime app settings and enable "Audio enhancements"
 # Open and play a game
 # Disable "Audio enhancements"
 # Repeat step 5

h1. Actual behavior
---- 
 * Audio enhancements option makes no difference on game audio

h2. Expected behavior
---- 
 * Audio enhancements option should make a difference on gaming experience

h2. Remarks
---- 
 * Issue timestamp: 15:30 pm
 * [BugReport|https://drive.google.com/file/d/12-isYdGWkHavTITNvSsX2UnAqjpZkhpV/view?usp=sharing]
 * Test Case Execution ID: [MCA-2050305|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2050305]
 * [^game-audio-issue.mp4]

This form was per-reviewed by [~mailtonf]
COMMENT: Moving to *Game Mode* for analysis.

it seems more like a task for audio tuning 
I will close this CR as WAD and create a new one for audio tuning with the description
"There is no much difference between the profiles when Game profile is selected for Game"

description:
h2. Configuration
----
 * SW version: motorola/burton_retail/burton:12/S0PB32.15/f6fbb-329d0:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * Build location: [Burton S0PB32.15|https://artifacts.mot.com:443/artifactory/burton/12/S0PB32.15/burton_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/fastboot_burton_retail_userdebug_12_S0PB32.15_f6fbb-329d0_intcfg-test-keys_retail_US.tar.gz]
 * External Display: Monitor Dell 2208WFPT - 1680x1050 (1080p - 60Hz)
 * USB-C Mobile Adapter - Dell DA310
 * Ready for Version: 01.3.0.027.0
 * Ready for Service Version: 02.00.0031.01
 * Moto Actions and Gestures version: 06.82.1.00-P

h2. Frequency
----
 * 100% *(5 of 5)* of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
 # Setup Wizard Completed
 # Wi-Fi available
 # USB-C Mobile Adapter connected
 # Three finger screenshot set On

h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Go to Desktop Mode settings
 # Click on Mirror Mode
 # Check the "Three finger screenshot" with immersive and mirror mode
 # Observe the External screen. 

h2. Actual behavior
----
 * The screenshot preview is not displayed on the Mirror mode screen

h2. Expected behavior
----
 * The screenshot previews should be displayed on the Mirror mode screen.
h2. Remarks
----

 * Test Case Execution ID:  [MCA-3119807|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3119807]
 * Issue timestamp: 10:12 - 10:13 pm
 * Bug2Go: [Link|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/317289067]
 * Video: !issuevideo.mp4|width=300,height=400! 
 * IMG: 
!IMG.PNG|thumbnail!

This form was peer-reviewed by:
COMMENT:
Request WAD,
Reason:

Since the long screenshot need to take screenshot again and again to joint a full long-screenshot,
and when the long screenshot engine is taking the screeshot, it must to show a the screenshot interaction to user.
And if we take the screenshot interaction into the screenshot, it will also  screenshot engine joint the full long-screenshot,
since the real screenshot that user wanted is the screen behind the screenshot interaction,
so we add PRIVATE_FLAG_IS_ROUNDED_CORNERS_OVERLAY to avoid  the screenshot interaction to be took in the screenshot. And this also cause screenshot interaction can not be recorded for mirror mode.

h2. Expected behavior

 * Issue timestamp: 13:36 pm

 * [Video|^apn.mp4]

This form was peer-reviewed by [~silvaa]
COMMENT:
[~josen] Platform Software team are doing the first level CR triage for flagship product upgrade, Lead Product upgrade, and NPIs. Denver is neither flagship product nor S upgrade lead product. That's why [~pku01] doesn't assign Denver CRs. 

 

[~graciosa]'s upgrade software team is doing the first level triage for general product upgrade. Please contact him for Denver CRs. Should it be needed, engineers in [~graciosa]'s team will discuss the issue with engineers in my team.

 

[~josen]  BTW, from the video of the CR, this might not be a issue. Please follow up with tester to see where this test case is from and what's the test result on other products. 

 

Basically, the APN matching is always prioritizing the finest match. In this case, an new APN with SPN = AT&T is added, which matches the SPN on the SIM. But, the original APN doesn't have any MVNO data set. Therefore, the new added APN becomes the finest match. This is expected behavior.

This form was peer-reviewed by [~silvaa]
COMMENT:
I would like to repeat my comments, "Basically, the APN matching is always prioritizing the finest match. In this case, an new APN with SPN = AT&T is added, which matches the SPN on the SIM. But, the original APN doesn't have any MVNO data set. Therefore, the new added APN becomes the finest match. This is expected behavior."

 

[~leidemar] Please revisit your test steps. If you added an APN with MVNO data that matches the SIM, it becomes the finest matched APN when the original APN doesn't have MVNO data configured. This is not an issue but expected behavior.

description:
h2. Configuration
----
 * SW version: motorola/nio_retail/nio:12/S1RT32.8/55adef-59969:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * Build location: [Tahoe S1RT32.8|https://artifacts.mot.com:443/artifactory/nio/12/S1RT32.8/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/fastboot_nio_retail_userdebug_12_S1RT32.8_55adef-59969_intcfg-test-keys_retail_US.tar.gz]
 * External Display: TV Samsung
 * Ready for Version: 01.3.0.061.0
 * Ready for Service Version: 02.00.0037.00
 * Camera Version: 8.0.85.4
 * Moto Version: 9.0.147
 * Moto Actions and Gestures Version: 06.82.1.00-P

h2. Frequency
----
 * 100% *(5 of 5)* of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
 # Setup Wizard Completed
 # Wi-Fi available
 # Ready For Assistant Available

h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Connect to Ready for Assistant
 # Open App tray 
 # Open Camera App on Desktop Mode
 # Try to trigger Quick Capture gestures 
 # Go to Home of the Phone side 
 # Try to trigger Quick Capture gestures 

h2. Actual behavior
----
 * Quick capture is not triggered on Desktop Mode and When clicking on the Home Screen of the phone side the Quick Capture Gestures open the camera and switch between rear and front functions.

h2. Expected behavior
----
 * According to this CR: IKSWR-43602, The Quick Capture Gestures is triggered in the side that receives the last interaction. So, should be possible to open on the Desktop Mode side. 

h2. Remarks
----
 * Test Case Execution ID:  [MCA-3149717|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3149717]
 * Issue timestamp: 07:32 - 07:34 am
 * Bug2Go: [Link|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/317792195]
 * Video: [Link|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cJSVJ_DbUkxreie6TwXL-1JJq3kR6R43/view?usp=sharing]

This form was peer-reviewed by:
COMMENT:
Hi [~diegoca], sorry for the delay, this is something that changed some time ago and got some confusion  along the way.

I believe at first framework reported the display on focus when we did a quick draw gesture. At some point this changed to always report the phone display.

So on IKMMINTG-35881 we disabled the quick draw gesture toggle as this feature won't work on desktop mode.

Today the expected behavior is to always open the camera on the phone display. If the camera is already open on desktop mode we ignore the intent.

Hope this clears this question, thanks

h2. Frequency
----
 * 100% *(5 of 5)* of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
 # Setup Wizard Completed
 # Wi-Fi available
 # Ready For Assistant Available
 # Have 2 PCs available (Win10/Win11)
 # PCs and Device should be in the same WIFI
 # Pair device on both PCs before the test 


h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Make sure that Ready for Assistant of win 11 have to available
 # Conect the device to Ready for Assistant of win 10 pc through the USB cable
 # Open "Ready for" through settings of the device
 # Observe the "Available devices" option

h2. Actual behavior
----
 * PC name only displayed in "Available devices" when Device connects to PC through USB cable, when disconnecting the cable, the PC name disappears (On Win10).
 * All test was executed with another PC on Win11 available by side and the PC name appears until all time. 

h2. Expected behavior
----
 * PC pairing should be displayed on "Available devices" without a USB cable.
 * The results of Win11 should be the same for Win10.

h2. Remarks
----
 * Test Case Execution ID:  [CQA-15895|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/CQA-15895]

 * TV model: Samsung TV UN32C5000QMXZD
 * Ready for Wireless 4K Adapter E1 Version: 1.12585.75
 * Ready for Version: 01.3.0.079.1
 * Ready for Engine Version: 02.00.0041.00


h2. Frequency
----
 * 100% *(5 of 5)* of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
 # Setup Wizard Completed
 # Wi-Fi available
 # Ready for Wireless 4K Available
 # Resolution set on 1360x768

h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Connect to Ready for Wireless 4k
 # Open App Tray
 # Pin 2 Apps on the taskbar 
 # Open Desktop Mode Settings 
 # Go to "Mode and resolution"
 # Try to change the resolution for all resolutions available
 # While the resolution is changing, interact with the 2 Apps pinned on the taskbar

h2. Actual behavior
----
 * The "|" of Apps pinned on Taskbar is disappear when changing the resolution 
 * Some Apps is displayed cut and need to scroll for the right side to view the app and the "|" 

h2. Expected behavior
----
* The right "|" should be pinned in the taskbar. (NOTE: the left "|" is pinned in the taskbar). (suggestion)
  !suggestion.png|thumbnail!
 * The taskbar should be readjusted when the resolution is changed

h2. Remarks
----
 * Test Case Execution ID:  [MCA-3255028|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3255028]
 * Issue timestamp: 03:39 pm
 * Bug2Go: [Link|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/318450640]
 * Video: !Video.mp4|width=300,height=400!

This form was peer-reviewed by:
COMMENT:
The resolution is reduced. When the recent task area becomes smaller, you can see "|" by sliding left and right.
Work as design. *Request WAD*

This form was peer-reviewed by:  [~mailtonf]
COMMENT:
1. Drag and hold the middle button to simulate scrolling the page like a mouse
2. As shown in the trackpad.png, when the user drags the button downward, the event of sliding the finger upward will be simulated. The handle that comes with the external screen game app is judged to be the up event.
3. *And air mouse is not suitable for handle in game mode*

description:
h2. Configuration
----
 * SW Version: motorola/burton_retail/burton:12/SPB32.131/9d695-cb75e:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * Build location: [SPB32.131 |https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/burton/12/SPB32.131/burton_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/]

h2. Frequency
----
 * 100% (7 of 7) of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
 # Have a way to make/receive a video call configured (Whatsapp or Duo)
 # Edge lights ON by default in Moto Display
 # Call edge notifications should be enable 

h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # While test device is face-down, receive a video call from Duo / WhatsApp and check the waterfall lightning on the edge.
 # Observe

h2. Actual behavior
----
 * Edge light stops midway through incoming call. The call keeps ringing but the edge light has already stopped.

h2. Expected behavior
----
 * When DUT receives a call with device facedown, the edge of the device should light up normally to indicate the incoming call.

h2. Remarks
----
 * Test Case Execution ID: CQA-18623
 * Issue timestamp: 02:42 pm
 * Bug2Go: https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/318795205
 * Video1: [VID_Google_Duo.mp4| https://drive.google.com/file/d/1V1_Lw_Pusz4G7zrvcTpoSb4aGYzvQs9I/view?usp=sharing] 
 * Video2: [VID_WhatsApp.mp4 |https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uyQblyc9R_oNWda6RBci2AtZXWN0JIco/view?usp=sharing]

h2. Configuration

----
* SW Version: motorola/nio_retail/nio:12/SRT32.135/e881f-83a03d:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
* Build Location: [Link|https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/nio/12/SRT32.135/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/] 


h2. Frequency
----
* 100% (5 of 5)



h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----

# Game installed eg: Candy Crush


h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
# Receive message from 2 different numbers
# Dismiss *one* bubble
# Observe
# Receive message 
# Dont open the bubble
# Observe

h1. Actual behavior
----
* When closing one bubble, all of them are closed. When not oppening a bubble its dismissed automatically after an avarege of 10 seconds. 


h2. Expected behavior
----
* User should be able to dissmis only one bubble and not all of them. Bubble should keep in the interface while playing a game even if bubble message is not opened.


h2. Remarks
----
* Issue timestamp:  01:30pm
* Video: [Link|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ElX-Qn6pJk5paV9sVHKlNZ_U_YNmP4KF/view?usp=sharing] 
* LogBug2Go: [Link|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/318860880]
* Test Case Execution ID: [MCA-3292816|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3292816] 

 

This form was per-reviewed by []
COMMENT: Moving to *FW UX - SystemUI*.

description:
[Precondition]
 1. Device is Rogue ROW - with TIM SIM card
 2. Build: motorola/hiphi_g/hiphi:12/S2SH32.8/922c65-48a30:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 3. Setup wizard finished

[Steps]
 1. Go to Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile network > Data Warning & limit
 2. Set data limit (tap on toggle)
 3. Connect on Wifi network (optional)
 4. Go to Settings > System > Reset Options > Reset Wi-Fi, mobile & Bluetooth
 5. Click on the "Reset Settings" button
 6. Confirm the reset by clicking on "Reset Settings" again

[Occurrence]
 1. The device will perform a network settings reset

2. The data limit parameter is not being reset

[Expected Results] 
 4. All network settings should be reset (such as wifi, mobile options, and data limit configured before)

[Results]

 

[Remarks]
 #1. Video: [^screen-20220311-122742.mp4]
 #2. Logs: [^reset_networking_settings.txt]
 #3. Device Information: [^device_information.txt]
COMMENT:
Hi, 

The TC was refactored to embrace this behavior. Can you close this CR as a WAD? since the feature is working properly.

COMMENT:
Hi [~hermann],
Each TC usually comes from a piece of requirement of a certain carrier. But we never got such requirement before. 
Pls have the author of the TC clarify which carrier's requirement this TC is for. If it was missed before, pls have this carrier's TAM submit a feature to it. 
Otherwise, if we don't have any evidence that we must support it, pls change the TC and close it. Thanks.

[Steps]

 2. Set data limit (tap on toggle)
 3. Connect on Wifi network (optional)
 4. Go to Settings > System > Reset Options > Reset Wi-Fi, mobile & Bluetooth

[Occurrence]

2. The data limit parameter is not being reset

[Expected Results] 
 4. All network settings should be reset (such as wifi, mobile options, and data limit configured before)

[Results]

 

[Remarks]
 #1. Video: [^screen-20220311-122742.mp4]
 #2. Logs: [^reset_networking_settings.txt]
 #3. Device Information: [^device_information.txt]
COMMENT:
Hi, [~wra039]. The TC is [TE - TC - Reset networking setting (Cellular Data)|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3297512], which refers to reset mobile data connection, *mobile data limit*, and all tethering settings are back to *factory default.* As the mobile data limit is disabled by default after setup wizard, it should be disabled as it is by default after factory settings are reset.

 

Best regards, Hermann.

Common Validation - Automation Team

 2. Build: motorola/hiphi_g/hiphi:12/S2SH32.8/922c65-48a30:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 3. Setup wizard finished

[Steps]
 1. Go to Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile network > Data Warning & limit
 2. Set data limit (tap on toggle)
 3. Connect on Wifi network (optional)
 4. Go to Settings > System > Reset Options > Reset Wi-Fi, mobile & Bluetooth
 5. Click on the "Reset Settings" button
 6. Confirm the reset by clicking on "Reset Settings" again

[Occurrence]
 1. The device will perform a network settings reset

2. The data limit parameter is not being reset

[Expected Results] 
 4. All network settings should be reset (such as wifi, mobile options, and data limit configured before)

[Results]

 

[Remarks]
 #1. Video: [^screen-20220311-122742.mp4]
 #2. Logs: [^reset_networking_settings.txt]
 #3. Device Information: [^device_information.txt]
COMMENT: The behavior should be same on all reference devices from Moto right now. We don't have a requirement that Data warning limit must be cleared. Do you have any requirements asking for that?

# Have recents apps available (dialer one of them)

h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
# Acess brownser
# Swipe to split
# Acess recent apps
# Take a screenshot from the button on the bottom of the page.
# Take a screenshot from power key and volume down.
# Observe. 

h1. Actual behavior
----
* Screenshots are different.


h2. Expected behavior
----
* Screenshot functions should take the same screenshot.


h2. Remarks
----
* Issue timestamp:  04:19pm
* Video: [Link|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BaS-KmW_xUed7xNsJT_XimsjTeDoEJOr/view?usp=sharing] 
* LogBug2Go: [Link|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/319261499]

This form was per-reviewed by []
COMMENT:
*Problem description:* Different screesnhots are taken from Recents screenshot button and volume+power key.

*Root cause analysis status:* Identified

*Root cause summary:* Recents screenshot button takes a screenshot from the current app showing on the recents carousel, whereas the volume+power key screenshot takes a screenshot from the whole contents of the screen.

*Next Step:* This is working as expected. So, requesting Work As Designed.

h2. Remarks
----
 * Issue timestamp: 03:25 pm
 * Bug2Go: [321317945|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/321317945]
 * Video: [^Preferred Network Type.mp4]
 * Test charter executed: [MCA-166659|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-166659]

This form was per-reviewed by [~silvaa]
COMMENT:
*Description:* Preferred network type change does not persist after switching mobile data service to SIM 2
 *Subcomponent:* Data
 *Analysis:* For DSDS devices, after changing the DDS, the Preferred Network Type will reset to default. This feature was introduced in Android O and had some improvements at R. For reference:
- [Android O feature| https://idart.mot.com/browse/IKSWO-70256?focusedCommentId=7196578&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-7196578]
- [Android R improvements| https://idart.mot.com/browse/IKSWR-6269]

We also have some CRs with the same scenario where those are as closed as WAD, like IKSWT-9683 and IKSWS-75088.

*Next Steps:* Please [~wjm097], based on the information above and [this comment| https://idart.mot.com/browse/IKSWR-69231?focusedCommentId=10491597&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-10491597], could you close this CR as WAD?

Regards,
 Alisson.

description:
=== Reproducing the issue ===

h5. SW version:
- motorola/astro_retail/astro:10/QPL30.85/9c214:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

h5. Build location: [QPL30.85|https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/astro/10/QPL30.85/astro_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
HW version: DVT1B
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

h5. Setup steps or Settings
{quote}
# Have SIM Cards TIM and Oi available and they are inserted.
# Device supports Multiuser feature

{quote}

h5. Steps to reproduce
{quote}
# Go to Secondary User > Check Wifi preferences under wifi settings

{quote}

*Actual result:*
- "Switch off data when connected to any Wi-Fi network" is NOT displayed under wifi-preferences to Secondary user

*Expected result:*
- "Switch off data when connected to any Wi-Fi network" is displayed under wifi-preferences to Secondary user

*Reproduce Rate:* 100%

=== Additional information ===

Dalek cycle path: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2325260
Test Case ID:https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2334560

*Bug2Go link:*
- 		https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/310035742

Issue timestamp: 13:00(device time)
COMMENT:
Current behavior is exctly the expected one.

MSimSettings assistants only run on primary user since we have some limitations running them on other users.

So, this option is not available for secondary users.

Suggest to close as WAD.

description:
=== Reproducing the issue ===

*SW Version:* 
motorola/sofiap_retail/sofiap:10/QPR30.Q4-17/9eee4:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

*Build location:*
https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/sofiap/10/QPR30.Q4-17/sofiap_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys

*HW version:*
PVT

------------------------------------------------------------------

*Setup steps or settings:*

# Have a device with STYLUS

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Opne the Moto Note App
# Go to settings and enable Watermark option
# Create a note
# Change the system time to a few days later on Phone Settings
# Open the last note created in Moto Note and edit then and observe the Watermark during the edition

*Actual result:*
- Watermark doesn't change immediately, just change if the note was save again.

*Expected result:*
- Watermark should change immediately during edition.

=== Additional information ===

Number of times the issue has been reproduced: 5/5 - 100.00%

Dalek cycle path: https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2392621

h5. Screenshots:
- Scenario Before update: [^P_Game_profile.png], [^P_Movie_profile.png], [^P_Music_profile.png]
- Scenario After update: [^Q_MotoAudio.png], [^Q_Game_profile.png], [^Q_Movie_profile.png], [^Q_Music_profile.png]

h5. Comments
- From the TC [MCA-2437078|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2437078] it's known that in migrations from O to P the settings don't remain (IKSWP24864, IKSWP-4633).
- Migrations from P to Q settings should remain.
- On this CR, make sense that all settings remain. The update could be a security package and this should not impact Moto Audio settings
COMMENT:
This behavior is expected we are resetting all settings to avoid an unexpected issue on some devices.

As it was not possible to fix individually this problem.
The development team discussed with the product team and they agreed with this solution. 
Although this is not good for the most of the users, it will avoid audio issues that can result in lots of complains about the device quality.

description:
=== *Reproducing the issue* ===

*SW version:* 
-motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-46/127d9a:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys

*Build location:* [Tahoe RRT31.Q3-46|https://artifacts.mot.com:443/artifactory/nio/11/RRT31.Q3-46/nio_retail/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/fastboot_nio_retail_userdebug_11_RRT31.Q3-46_127d9a_intcfg-test-keys_retail_US.tar.gz]

------------------------------------------------------------------
 *HW version:* DVT1a
 ------------------------------------------------------------------

*Setup steps or settings:*
{quote} # Peek Display set ON
 # English Language
 # Setup Wizard Completed 
 # All Apps Updated 
 # Screen Off {quote}

*Steps to reproduce:*
{quote} #  Receive 2 Messages from 2 different persons
 # Receive some Email from Gmail
 # Make sure all functions are in English.
 # Go to Settings > System > Languages and Input > Languages > Select Português Language 
 # Click on Power Button to Screen off
 # Observe all functions from AOD Screen {quote}

*Actual result:*
- When change the language of the Device to Português (Brasil). Some functions on AOD Screen are not changed for Português (Brasil) and continued in English.

*Expected result:*
 -  When change the language of the Device to Português (Brasil). All functions shall be changed for Portguês (Brasil).

*Number of times the issue has been reproduced:* 5/5 - 100.00%

=== *Additional information* ===

*Dalek Test Case path:* [Charter|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-2940111]

h1. *Screenshot file attached*
-----
 !Screen.jpg|thumbnail!  

h1. Video file attached
----
[Video.mp4|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B5qYosz8aMiu2asFfT-Mn5vEumOlw-NG/view?usp=sharing]

*Bugreport:*
 - [Bug2Go|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/315593136] - Issue timestamp: 11:36 AM device time

*Comments:*
- Moto Display Version: 08.338.6
- Message Version: 8.5.024
- Gmail Version: 2021.05.30.381370072 Release
- Languages: Português [Brasil] and English [Unitad State
- The Language changed when restart the device.

*This form was peer reviewed by: [~josen]
COMMENT: This seems to be WAD. The notifications are not automatically updated when the language changes, so it depends on the app that posted them to perform the update. It seems the Messages app doesn't care about updating the current notification and only does it when there is a new message. On AoD this is also ok, because if AoD depends on the notification to retrieve the actions labels, so it's doing what it's expected to.

COMMENT:
Hi [~qhpn87],

I was not able to find a CR for this issue. I believe the strings that are not being refreshed for the new locale belong to the GMS apps (Messages/GMail). The notification for those apps do not change after the locale is modified (strings like "Mark as read" or "Archive" are still displayed English in the Notification Panel). I'm not sure if this is WAD or if the notification should have to be reposted. There is ongoing CR about notification and locale change (IKSWQ-119331).

[~vkcr36], FYI.

description:
h1. Configuration
----
 * Build fingerprint: motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-57/400ed:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * External Display version: TV LED 32" Sony KDL-32R305B HD (1.366 x 768)
 * Wireless Dongle version: Ready For Wireless 4K Adapter 55 (Ready For Moto Dongle) 1.12585.61

h1. Frequency
----
 * 100% (10 of 10) of reproducibility

h1. Preconditions
----
 # An external display is connected to the phone via Ready For Wireless connection
 # Have a Wireless mouse connected via OTG cable

h1. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Open the Chooser Screen (Experience Hub)
 # Connect/Disconnect OTG cable

h1. Actual behavior
----
 * Home screen is shown briefly after connecting OTG on Chooser Screen

h1. Expected behavior
----
 * OTG cable connection or disconnection shouldn't make the home screen be shown

h1. Remarks
----
 * Video: [^chooser_screen_issue.mp4]
 * Screenshot: [^chooser_screen_issue.jpg]
 * Issue timestamp: 11:35 am
 * Bug2Go: [315757483|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/315757483]

description:
h1. Configuration
----
 * Build fingerprint: motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-57/400ed:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * External Display version: TV LED 32" Sony KDL-32R305B HD (1.366 x 768)
 * Wireless Dongle version: Ready For Wireless 4K Adapter 55 (Ready For Moto Dongle) 1.12585.61

h1. Frequency
----
 * 100% (10 of 10) of reproducibility

h1. Preconditions
----
 # An external display is connected to the phone via Ready For Wireless connection
 # Have a Wireless mouse connected via OTG cable

h1. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Open the Chooser Screen (Experience Hub)
 # Connect/Disconnect OTG cable

h1. Actual behavior
----
 * Home screen is shown briefly after connecting OTG on Chooser Screen

h1. Expected behavior
----
 * OTG cable connection or disconnection shouldn't make the home screen be shown

h1. Remarks
----
 * Video: [^chooser_screen_issue.mp4]
 * Screenshot: [^chooser_screen_issue.jpg]
 * Issue timestamp: 11:35 am
 * Bug2Go: [315757483|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/315757483]
COMMENT:

h1. Configuration
----
 * Build fingerprint: motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-57/400ed:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * External Display version: TV LED 32" Sony KDL-32R305B HD (1.366 x 768)
 * Wireless Dongle version: Ready For Wireless 4K Adapter 55 (Ready For Moto Dongle) 1.12585.61

h1. Frequency
----
 * 100% (10 of 10) of reproducibility

h1. Preconditions
----
 # An external display is connected to the phone via Ready For Wireless connection
 # Have a Wireless mouse connected via OTG cable

h1. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Open the Chooser Screen (Experience Hub)
 # Connect/Disconnect OTG cable

h1. Actual behavior
----
 * Home screen is shown briefly after connecting OTG on Chooser Screen

h1. Expected behavior
----
 * OTG cable connection or disconnection shouldn't make the home screen be shown

h1. Remarks
----
 * Video: [^chooser_screen_issue.mp4]
 * Screenshot: [^chooser_screen_issue.jpg]
 * Issue timestamp: 11:35 am
 * Bug2Go: [315757483|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/315757483]

Please framework team help check why  the SecondaryDisplayLauncher  has been continuously pulled up

h1. Configuration
----
 * Build fingerprint: motorola/nio_retail/nio:11/RRT31.Q3-57/400ed:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * External Display version: TV LED 32" Sony KDL-32R305B HD (1.366 x 768)
 * Wireless Dongle version: Ready For Wireless 4K Adapter 55 (Ready For Moto Dongle) 1.12585.61

h1. Frequency
----
 * 100% (10 of 10) of reproducibility

h1. Preconditions
----
 # An external display is connected to the phone via Ready For Wireless connection
 # Have a Wireless mouse connected via OTG cable

h1. Steps to Reproduce
----
 # Open the Chooser Screen (Experience Hub)
 # Connect/Disconnect OTG cable

h1. Actual behavior
----
 * Home screen is shown briefly after connecting OTG on Chooser Screen

h1. Expected behavior
----
 * OTG cable connection or disconnection shouldn't make the home screen be shown

h1. Remarks
----
 * Video: [^chooser_screen_issue.mp4]
 * Screenshot: [^chooser_screen_issue.jpg]
 * Issue timestamp: 11:35 am
 * Bug2Go: [315757483|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/315757483]
COMMENT: This issue might need Chooser check first

h2. Configuration
----
 * SW version: motorola/hiphi_g/hiphi:12/SSH32.167/f0759-36b5a:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
 * Build location: [Rogue SSH32.167|https://artifacts.mot.com:443/artifactory/hiphi/12/SSH32.167/hiphi_g/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/fastboot_hiphi_g_userdebug_12_SSH32.167_f0759-36b5a_intcfg-test-keys_global_US.tar.gz]

h2. Frequency
----
 * 100% *(5 of 5)* of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
# Setup Wizard Completed


h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
# Open settings > accessibility > Talkback
# Enable TalkBack
# Open Quick Settings
# Receive a call while TalkBack is reading the Quick Settings infos

h2. Actual behavior
----
 * Talkback doesn't stop when receiving a incoming call to read the caller's name and infos
* Sometimes Talkback volume increases by itself to overlap the call ringtone

h2. Expected behavior
----
*  TalkBack should stop reading the screen infos to read the caller's infos

h2. Remarks
----
 * Test Case Execution ID:  [MCA-3447349|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3447349]
 * Issue timestamp: 10:55 - 11:10 am

This form was peer-reviewed by [~diegoca]
COMMENT: Hi [~chentq2]  , we ran this test on Pixel before opening this CR and the issue wasn't reproducing, but now it is reproducing.

description:
h2. Configuration
----
* Build version: motorola/hiphi_g/hiphi:12/S3SH32.14/6f0de-84bc0:userdebug/intcfg,test-keys
* Carrier: RetBr
* Hardware version: dvt2

h2. Frequency
----
* 100% (5 of 5) of reproducibility 


h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
----
# Active pen plugged into the Folio case


h2. Steps to Reproduce
----
# Put the device in the Folio case


h1. Actual behavior
----
* The pen is connected via bluetooth, but the pen icon only appears on the AoD screen with the Folio case closed. When the Folio case is open the icon does not appear.


h2. Expected behavior
----
* The pen is connected via bluetooth and the pen icon appears on the AoD screen with the Folio case closed and open.


h2. Remarks
----
* Issue timestamp: 04:16 pm
* Test Case ID: [MCA-3179465|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3179465]
* Bug2Go: [320158394|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/320158394]
* Video: [link|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iFOeYx1jjt6aTL3TNE-ynrqVsrF0sa6m/view?usp=sharing]
 

This form was per-reviewed by [~]
COMMENT:
This is not a requirement. Icon pen only appears on Folio UI, i.e., folio case is closed.

[https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1F64XI8BrHSztwkK8g7ytoeRnaNPICLJY09YczZCPF94/edit#slide=id.ge6d082e17a_0_2319]

description:
h2. Configuration
---- 
* SW version: [S3SH32.19|https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/hiphi/12/S3SH32.19/hiphi_g/userdebug/intcfg_test-keys/fastboot_hiphi_g_userdebug_12_S3SH32.19_3e61e-8f7c7b_intcfg-test-keys_global_US.tar.gz]
 * Notebook: Lenovo ThinkPad T470, SO: Windows 10
 * Ready For Assistant version:  [READYFORASSIST-03.5.0.030.000|https://artifacts.mot.com/artifactory/continuous_builds/apps/readyforassist_pc_win/apps_win_readyforassist_master_continuous/1282/build_win/ReadyFor_setup.exe]

h2. Frequency
---- 
* 100% (10 of 10) of reproducibility

h2. Preconditions/Setup steps
---- 
# Setup Wizard Completed
 # Phone and PC are in Same Wi-Fi connection
 # Phone is paired with Laptop

h2. Steps to Reproduce
---- 
# Launch RFA on PC
 # In RFA: Hover over the phone area & Click on Open app on PC option
 # Open any app app tray
 # Press Screenshot button on the taskbar of App streaming view (choose Full Screen or Window mode to better understanding)
 # Open the same app on device
 # Take a screenshot
 # Observe

h2. Actual behavior
---- 
* Both screenshots differ on quality, the app streaming screenshot has lower quality, which is better seen on the device's gallery

h2. Expected behavior
---- 
* Both screenshots should have the same quality

h2. Remarks
---- 
* Test Case Execution ID: [MCA-3531538|https://dalek.mot.com/browse/MCA-3531538]
 * Issue timestamp: 10:25 - 10:35 am
 * Bug2Go: [link|https://mmibug2go.appspot.com/#/app/report/320234397]
 * Drive : [link|https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/126aCdkMBWd_85dnMZlGY2vt-jItpCF4K?usp=sharing]

This form was peer-reviewed by [~diegoca]
COMMENT:
app stream display has different resolution & density than device's screen

and normally app on stream display won't as nice as on device's screen
